intro: Achyronia hirta, commonly known as the hairy achyronia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Achyronia hirta is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
